stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Course 14 (“craft level”) for Return to Yoshi’s Island, building placeholder assets (crayons, plastic cup, cardboard trees, tilting bridge, desk-lamp skybox) and outlining five star concepts while waiting for Zeina’s Course 13 art. He tests performance on real N64 hardware, targets ≥30 FPS within a 64 MB ROM limit, and discusses future build/release strategy.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 theme is household craft materials; NPCs are simple “doodles” so the level will have minimal narrative to keep design straightforward.
development_findings.quote: “This is the craft level. It’s made out of craft materials, the whole thing… all the NPCs… are going to be very robotic.”

development_findings.summary: Five preliminary star ideas: (1) stop ‘squirrels’ eating Yoshi’s apples, (2) reach a Toad doodle on a mountain, (3) draw a star for a Luigi doodle by delivering a yellow crayon, (4) platforming inside an opened cardboard box, (5) red-coin area guarded by a rolling ‘weasel ball’, plus an 8-bit pipe to Mario Paint.
64 MB ROM cap is enforced for the hack; Kaze begins by importing very low-poly placeholders and will iterate art later.
development_findings.quote: “Did you set a limit on the ROM size?  – Yes, 64 MB.”

development_findings.summary: Real-hardware test shows 25–50 FPS; cloud count can be halved to secure 30 FPS; shading bug spotted, likely material related.
development_findings.quote: “We’re in the 50s… 25 there. I can very easily increase the FPS by just reducing the amount of clouds.”

development_findings.summary: Engine has ongoing optimisations; recently integrated F3DX3 microcode and moved heavy math (e.g., sin/cos) to CPU, but RSP is now the bottleneck.
development_findings.quote: “Once you actually optimise the memory throughput, the RSP became the bottleneck… Just recently we imported F3DX3.”

development_findings.summary: Future build plan: v1.0 runs on emulator & N64; v1.1 same; v1.2 targets only real N64, forcing emulators to adapt.
development_findings.quote: “1.2 is only N64… emulators will then technologically have to catch up with the game.”

development_findings.summary: Uses reflective texturing trick for plastic cups and will multiply/add textures for ridged effect; ready to trade private texture repo for full game rips.
Desk-lamp model added as in-world light source; lens-flare test done to sell ‘built on a desk’ concept.
Imported F3DX3 microcodes and plans further RSP work (Sauraen handling) for better performance.

context_findings.summary: Kaze only accepts sponsorships he finds meaningful or can subvert; currently negotiating Raid Shadow Legends via ChatGPT to ‘mess with them’.
context_findings.quote: “Generally, I never take sponsorships unless I can think of a way to like fuck them over… I legit just went to ChatGPT and told it make me as much money as possible.”

context_findings.summary: Focused on YouTube growth for financing and PR; pleased that latest video and ‘grass’ video perform well and plans more similar content.
context_findings.quote: “Life is good today… The algorithm is so obsessed with the problem with the grass video.”

context_findings.summary: Parents visited for 10 days, forcing yard work; notes sunburn and reduced stream time.
Personal: became a father ~7 weeks ago (daughter Reina); working toward Canadian citizenship through marriage to Zeina.
context_findings.quote: “I became a father seven weeks and six days ago. I have a small daughter now, her name is Reina.”

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on design: prioritises intuitive movement and spectacle over dense puzzles; uses last-impact experience as negative lesson.
context_findings.quote: “Back then my mindset was never ‘can I make this fun’; it was ‘I have an idea, I’ll put it in’… This time I’m avoiding too much puzzle.”

biobak.summary: Will handle final visual pass for Course 14 and has already removed ~400 polygons from Course 13 trees, replacing them with lower-poly assets.
biobak.quote: “Removed the trees around the area… That killed 400 polygons.”

biobak.summary: Took a day off by Kaze’s suggestion; texture repo trade policy mentioned.

zeina.summary: Finishing exterior area of Course 13 and testing new physics; provided feedback that movement feels intuitive.
zeina.quote: “I had Zeina test it, and she managed to move pretty well with these physics.”

zeina.summary: Sketching ideas for the overworld (Yoshi’s Fruit Islands) and working on outside areas.

key_stories.title: Real-Hardware Performance Check
key_stories.summary: Kaze loads Course 13 on an N64 to see whether new cloud geometry and physics maintain 30 FPS. Frame-rate dips to 25 FPS, revealing a shading bug.
key_stories.challenge: Need to guarantee 30 FPS on real console despite complex cloud visuals.
key_stories.process: Tested level live, inspected profiler values, discussed reducing cloud count by half.
key_stories.outcome: Decided to cut cloud density; confident performance target is attainable.
key_stories.key_quote: “I can very easily increase the FPS by just reducing the amount of clouds.”

key_stories.title: Negotiating a Sponsorship with AI
key_stories.summary: Raid Shadow Legends offered a sponsorship; Kaze dislikes ads but sees comedic potential. He let ChatGPT draft the negotiation emails and plans a 4-hour ‘every visible wall’ video that mocks the sponsor.
key_stories.challenge: Fund development without compromising principles against intrusive ads.
key_stories.process: Prompted ChatGPT: ‘make me as much money as possible’; forwarded the auto-generated text to Raid.
key_stories.outcome: Waiting on Raid’s response; intends to proceed only if he can subvert the ad.
key_stories.key_quote: “I didn’t even read this, I just said send… I never take sponsorships unless I can think of a way to fuck them over.”
